info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 3:49PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS, RAPIDLY FALLING TEMPERATURES AND GUSTY WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN MA... Rain showers in western MA will quickly change to a brief period of heavy snow across western MA between 4 and 5 pm. This will first occur in the Berkshires then spread to the east. The snow will be accompanied by poor visibility, temperatures falling sharply into the upper 20s and lower 30s and gusty winds. Any accumulation will be an inch or less, but the combination of falling temps and snow will result in hazardous travel conditions. Conditions will improve by 6 pm. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.
